data.price: (1) Blessed is He in whose hand is dominion, and He is over all things competent -
data.arabic: تَبَٰرَكَ ٱلَّذِي بِيَدِهِ ٱلۡمُلۡكُ وَهُوَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيۡءٖ قَدِيرٌ

data.price: (2) [He] who created death and life to test you [as to] which of you is best in deed - and He is the Exalted in Might, the Forgiving -
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِي خَلَقَ ٱلۡمَوۡتَ وَٱلۡحَيَوٰةَ لِيَبۡلُوَكُمۡ أَيُّكُمۡ أَحۡسَنُ عَمَلٗاۚ وَهُوَ ٱلۡعَزِيزُ ٱلۡغَفُورُ

data.price: (3) [And] who created seven heavens in layers.[1712] You do not see in the creation of the Most Merciful any inconsistency. So return [your] vision [to the sky]; do you see any breaks?
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِي خَلَقَ سَبۡعَ سَمَٰوَٰتٖ طِبَاقٗاۖ مَّا تَرَىٰ فِي خَلۡقِ ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنِ مِن تَفَٰوُتٖۖ فَٱرۡجِعِ ٱلۡبَصَرَ هَلۡ تَرَىٰ مِن فُطُورٖ
data.footnotes: [1712]- i.e., one covering or fitting over the other.

data.price: (4) Then return [your] vision twice again.[1713] [Your] vision will return to you humbled while it is fatigued.
data.arabic: ثُمَّ ٱرۡجِعِ ٱلۡبَصَرَ كَرَّتَيۡنِ يَنقَلِبۡ إِلَيۡكَ ٱلۡبَصَرُ خَاسِئٗا وَهُوَ حَسِيرٞ
data.footnotes: [1713]- i.e., repeatedly.

data.price: (5) And We have certainly beautified the nearest heaven with lamps [i.e., stars] and have made [from] them what is thrown at the devils[1714] and have prepared for them the punishment of the Blaze.
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ زَيَّنَّا ٱلسَّمَآءَ ٱلدُّنۡيَا بِمَصَٰبِيحَ وَجَعَلۡنَٰهَا رُجُومٗا لِّلشَّيَٰطِينِۖ وَأَعۡتَدۡنَا لَهُمۡ عَذَابَ ٱلسَّعِيرِ
data.footnotes: [1714]- Thereby driving them from the heavens and preventing them from eavesdropping.  See 72:8-9.

data.price: (6) And for those who disbelieved in their Lord is the punishment of Hell, and wretched is the destination.
data.arabic: وَلِلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ بِرَبِّهِمۡ عَذَابُ جَهَنَّمَۖ وَبِئۡسَ ٱلۡمَصِيرُ

data.price: (7) When they are thrown into it, they hear from it a [dreadful] inhaling while it boils up.
data.arabic: إِذَآ أُلۡقُواْ فِيهَا سَمِعُواْ لَهَا شَهِيقٗا وَهِيَ تَفُورُ

data.price: (8) It almost bursts with rage. Every time a company is thrown into it, its keepers ask them, "Did there not come to you a warner?"
data.arabic: تَكَادُ تَمَيَّزُ مِنَ ٱلۡغَيۡظِۖ كُلَّمَآ أُلۡقِيَ فِيهَا فَوۡجٞ سَأَلَهُمۡ خَزَنَتُهَآ أَلَمۡ يَأۡتِكُمۡ نَذِيرٞ

data.price: (9) They will say, "Yes, a warner had come to us, but we denied and said, 'Allāh has not sent down anything. You are not but in great error.'"
data.arabic: قَالُواْ بَلَىٰ قَدۡ جَآءَنَا نَذِيرٞ فَكَذَّبۡنَا وَقُلۡنَا مَا نَزَّلَ ٱللَّهُ مِن شَيۡءٍ إِنۡ أَنتُمۡ إِلَّا فِي ضَلَٰلٖ كَبِيرٖ

data.price: (10) And they will say, "If only we had been listening or reasoning, we would not be among the companions of the Blaze."
data.arabic: وَقَالُواْ لَوۡ كُنَّا نَسۡمَعُ أَوۡ نَعۡقِلُ مَا كُنَّا فِيٓ أَصۡحَٰبِ ٱلسَّعِيرِ

data.price: (11) And they will admit their sin, so [it is] alienation[1715] for the companions of the Blaze.
data.footnotes: [1715]- From all good and from Allāh's mercy.

data.price: (12) Indeed, those who fear their Lord unseen will have forgiveness and great reward.
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يَخۡشَوۡنَ رَبَّهُم بِٱلۡغَيۡبِ لَهُم مَّغۡفِرَةٞ وَأَجۡرٞ كَبِيرٞ

data.price: (13) And conceal your speech or publicize it; indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts.
data.arabic: وَأَسِرُّواْ قَوۡلَكُمۡ أَوِ ٱجۡهَرُواْ بِهِۦٓۖ إِنَّهُۥ عَلِيمُۢ بِذَاتِ ٱلصُّدُورِ

data.price: (14) Does He who created not know,[1716] while He is the Subtle, the Aware?
data.arabic: أَلَا يَعۡلَمُ مَنۡ خَلَقَ وَهُوَ ٱللَّطِيفُ ٱلۡخَبِيرُ
data.footnotes: [1716]- Another accepted meaning is "Does He not know those whom He created...?"

data.price: (15) It is He who made the earth tame[1717] for you - so walk among its slopes and eat of His provision - and to Him is the resurrection.
data.arabic: هُوَ ٱلَّذِي جَعَلَ لَكُمُ ٱلۡأَرۡضَ ذَلُولٗا فَٱمۡشُواْ فِي مَنَاكِبِهَا وَكُلُواْ مِن رِّزۡقِهِۦۖ وَإِلَيۡهِ ٱلنُّشُورُ
data.footnotes: [1717]- i.e., stable and subservient.

data.price: (16) Do you feel secure that He who is above[1718] would not cause the earth to swallow you and suddenly it would sway?[1719]
data.arabic: ءَأَمِنتُم مَّن فِي ٱلسَّمَآءِ أَن يَخۡسِفَ بِكُمُ ٱلۡأَرۡضَ فَإِذَا هِيَ تَمُورُ
data.footnotes:
[1718]- Literally, "in ascendancy" or "over the heaven."
[1719]- In a circular motion, as in an earthquake.

data.price: (17) Or do you feel secure that He who is above would not send against you a storm of stones? Then you would know how [severe] was My warning.
data.arabic: أَمۡ أَمِنتُم مَّن فِي ٱلسَّمَآءِ أَن يُرۡسِلَ عَلَيۡكُمۡ حَاصِبٗاۖ فَسَتَعۡلَمُونَ كَيۡفَ نَذِيرِ

data.price: (18) And already had those before them denied, and how [terrible] was My reproach.
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ كَذَّبَ ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبۡلِهِمۡ فَكَيۡفَ كَانَ نَكِيرِ

data.price: (19) Do they not see the birds above them with wings outspread and [sometimes] folded in? None holds them [aloft] except the Most Merciful. Indeed He is, of all things, Seeing.
data.arabic: أَوَلَمۡ يَرَوۡاْ إِلَى ٱلطَّيۡرِ فَوۡقَهُمۡ صَٰٓفَّٰتٖ وَيَقۡبِضۡنَۚ مَا يُمۡسِكُهُنَّ إِلَّا ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنُۚ إِنَّهُۥ بِكُلِّ شَيۡءِۭ بَصِيرٌ

data.price: (20) Or who is it that could be an army for you to aid you other than the Most Merciful? The disbelievers are not but in delusion.
data.arabic: أَمَّنۡ هَٰذَا ٱلَّذِي هُوَ جُندٞ لَّكُمۡ يَنصُرُكُم مِّن دُونِ ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنِۚ إِنِ ٱلۡكَٰفِرُونَ إِلَّا فِي غُرُورٍ

data.price: (21) Or who is it that could provide for you if He withheld His provision? But they have persisted in insolence and aversion.
data.arabic: أَمَّنۡ هَٰذَا ٱلَّذِي يَرۡزُقُكُمۡ إِنۡ أَمۡسَكَ رِزۡقَهُۥۚ بَل لَّجُّواْ فِي عُتُوّٖ وَنُفُورٍ

data.price: (22) Then is one who walks fallen on his face better guided or one who walks erect on a straight path?
data.arabic: أَفَمَن يَمۡشِي مُكِبًّا عَلَىٰ وَجۡهِهِۦٓ أَهۡدَىٰٓ أَمَّن يَمۡشِي سَوِيًّا عَلَىٰ صِرَٰطٖ مُّسۡتَقِيمٖ

data.price: (23) Say, "It is He who has produced you and made for you hearing and vision and hearts [i.e., intellect]; little are you grateful."
data.arabic: قُلۡ هُوَ ٱلَّذِيٓ أَنشَأَكُمۡ وَجَعَلَ لَكُمُ ٱلسَّمۡعَ وَٱلۡأَبۡصَٰرَ وَٱلۡأَفۡـِٔدَةَۚ قَلِيلٗا مَّا تَشۡكُرُونَ

data.price: (24) Say, "It is He who has multiplied you throughout the earth, and to Him you will be gathered."
data.arabic: قُلۡ هُوَ ٱلَّذِي ذَرَأَكُمۡ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَإِلَيۡهِ تُحۡشَرُونَ

data.price: (25) And they say, "When is this promise, if you should be truthful?"
data.arabic: وَيَقُولُونَ مَتَىٰ هَٰذَا ٱلۡوَعۡدُ إِن كُنتُمۡ صَٰدِقِينَ

data.price: (26) Say, "The knowledge is only with Allāh, and I am only a clear warner."
data.arabic: قُلۡ إِنَّمَا ٱلۡعِلۡمُ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ وَإِنَّمَآ أَنَا۠ نَذِيرٞ مُّبِينٞ

data.price: (27) But when they see it[1720] approaching, the faces of those who disbelieve will be distressed, and it will be said, "This is that for which you used to call."[1721]
data.arabic: فَلَمَّا رَأَوۡهُ زُلۡفَةٗ سِيٓـَٔتۡ وُجُوهُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ وَقِيلَ هَٰذَا ٱلَّذِي كُنتُم بِهِۦ تَدَّعُونَ
data.footnotes:
[1720]- The punishment of which they were warned.
[1721]- When they challenged their prophets, saying, "Bring on the punishment, if you are truthful."

data.price: (28) Say, [O Muḥammad], "Have you considered:[1722] whether Allāh should cause my death and those with me or have mercy upon us, who can protect the disbelievers from a painful punishment?"
data.arabic: قُلۡ أَرَءَيۡتُمۡ إِنۡ أَهۡلَكَنِيَ ٱللَّهُ وَمَن مَّعِيَ أَوۡ رَحِمَنَا فَمَن يُجِيرُ ٱلۡكَٰفِرِينَ مِنۡ عَذَابٍ أَلِيمٖ
data.footnotes: [1722]- i.e., inform me.

data.price: (29) Say, "He is the Most Merciful; we have believed in Him, and upon Him we have relied. And you will [come to] know who it is that is in clear error."
data.arabic: قُلۡ هُوَ ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنُ ءَامَنَّا بِهِۦ وَعَلَيۡهِ تَوَكَّلۡنَاۖ فَسَتَعۡلَمُونَ مَنۡ هُوَ فِي ضَلَٰلٖ مُّبِينٖ

data.price: (30) Say, "Have you considered: if your water was to become sunken [into the earth], then who could bring you flowing water?"
data.arabic: قُلۡ أَرَءَيۡتُمۡ إِنۡ أَصۡبَحَ مَآؤُكُمۡ غَوۡرٗا فَمَن يَأۡتِيكُم بِمَآءٖ مَّعِينِۭ

data.price: (1) Nūn.[1724] By the pen and what they inscribe,
data.footnotes: [1724]- See footnote to 2:1.

data.price: (2) You are not, [O Muḥammad], by the favor of your Lord, a madman.
(3) And indeed, for you is a reward uninterrupted.
(4) And indeed, you are of a great moral character.
(5) So you will see and they will see
(6) Which of you is the afflicted [by a devil].
(7) Indeed, your Lord is most knowing of who has gone astray from His way, and He is most knowing of the [rightly] guided.
data.arabic: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعۡلَمُ بِمَن ضَلَّ عَن سَبِيلِهِۦ وَهُوَ أَعۡلَمُ بِٱلۡمُهۡتَدِينَ

data.price: (8) Then do not obey the deniers.
(9) They wish that you would soften [in your position], so they would soften [toward you].
(10) And do not obey every worthless habitual swearer
(11) [And] scorner, going about with malicious gossip -
(12) A preventer of good, transgressing and sinful,
(13) Cruel, moreover, and an illegitimate pretender.[1725]
data.footnotes: [1725]- i.e., claiming a particular lineage falsely.  The description given in these verses is of al-Waleed bin al-Mugheerah (see also 74:11-25) or possibly, as asserted by Ibn Katheer, al-Akhnas bin Shurayq.

data.price: (14) Because he is a possessor of wealth and children,
(15) When Our verses are recited to him, he says, "Legends of the former peoples."
data.arabic: إِذَا تُتۡلَىٰ عَلَيۡهِ ءَايَٰتُنَا قَالَ أَسَٰطِيرُ ٱلۡأَوَّلِينَ

data.price: (16) We will brand him upon the snout.[1726]
data.footnotes: [1726]- Literally, "trunk," meaning the nose of an elephant or pig.

data.price: (17) Indeed, We have tried them as We tried the companions of the garden, when they swore to cut its fruit in the [early] morning
data.arabic: إِنَّا بَلَوۡنَٰهُمۡ كَمَا بَلَوۡنَآ أَصۡحَٰبَ ٱلۡجَنَّةِ إِذۡ أَقۡسَمُواْ لَيَصۡرِمُنَّهَا مُصۡبِحِينَ

data.price: (18) Without making exception.[1727]
data.footnotes: [1727]- i.e., without conceding that nothing can be accomplished unless Allāh wills, saying, "...if Allāh wills" ("in-shā’-Allāh").  See 18:23-24.

data.price: (19) So there came upon it [i.e., the garden] an affliction from your Lord while they were asleep.
data.arabic: فَطَافَ عَلَيۡهَا طَآئِفٞ مِّن رَّبِّكَ وَهُمۡ نَآئِمُونَ

data.price: (20) And it became as though reaped.
(21) And they called one another at morning,
(22) [Saying], "Go early to your crop if you would cut the fruit."
data.arabic: أَنِ ٱغۡدُواْ عَلَىٰ حَرۡثِكُمۡ إِن كُنتُمۡ صَٰرِمِينَ

data.price: (23) So they set out, while lowering their voices,
(24) [Saying], "There will surely not enter it today upon you [any] poor person."
data.arabic: أَن لَّا يَدۡخُلَنَّهَا ٱلۡيَوۡمَ عَلَيۡكُم مِّسۡكِينٞ

data.price: (25) And they went early in determination, [assuming themselves] able.[1728]
data.footnotes: [1728]- To carry out their plan, confident of their ability.

data.price: (26) But when they saw it, they said, "Indeed, we are lost;
(27) Rather, we have been deprived."
(28) The most moderate of them said, "Did I not say to you, 'Why do you not exalt [Allāh]?'"[1729]
data.arabic: قَالَ أَوۡسَطُهُمۡ أَلَمۡ أَقُل لَّكُمۡ لَوۡلَا تُسَبِّحُونَ
data.footnotes: [1729]- i.e., remember or mention Him by saying, "...if Allāh wills."  An additional meaning is "praise" or "thank" Him for His bounty.

data.price: (29) They said, "Exalted is our Lord! Indeed, we were wrongdoers."
data.arabic: قَالُواْ سُبۡحَٰنَ رَبِّنَآ إِنَّا كُنَّا ظَٰلِمِينَ

data.price: (30) Then they approached one another, blaming each other.
(31) They said, "O woe to us; indeed we were transgressors.
(32) Perhaps our Lord will substitute for us [one] better than it. Indeed, we are toward our Lord desirous."[1730]
data.arabic: عَسَىٰ رَبُّنَآ أَن يُبۡدِلَنَا خَيۡرٗا مِّنۡهَآ إِنَّآ إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا رَٰغِبُونَ
data.footnotes: [1730]- Of His mercy, forgiveness and bounty.

data.price: (33) Such is the punishment [of this world]. And the punishment of the Hereafter is greater, if they only knew.
data.arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ ٱلۡعَذَابُۖ وَلَعَذَابُ ٱلۡأٓخِرَةِ أَكۡبَرُۚ لَوۡ كَانُواْ يَعۡلَمُونَ

data.price: (34) Indeed, for the righteous with their Lord are the Gardens of Pleasure.
data.arabic: إِنَّ لِلۡمُتَّقِينَ عِندَ رَبِّهِمۡ جَنَّٰتِ ٱلنَّعِيمِ

data.price: (35) Then will We treat the Muslims like the criminals?
(36) What is [the matter] with you? How do you judge?
(37) Or do you have a scripture in which you learn
(38) That indeed for you is whatever you choose?
(39) Or do you have oaths [binding] upon Us, extending until the Day of Resurrection, that indeed for you is whatever you judge?
data.arabic: أَمۡ لَكُمۡ أَيۡمَٰنٌ عَلَيۡنَا بَٰلِغَةٌ إِلَىٰ يَوۡمِ ٱلۡقِيَٰمَةِ إِنَّ لَكُمۡ لَمَا تَحۡكُمُونَ

data.price: (40) Ask them which of them, for that [claim], is responsible.
(41) Or do they have partners?[1731] Then let them bring their partners, if they should be truthful.
data.arabic: أَمۡ لَهُمۡ شُرَكَآءُ فَلۡيَأۡتُواْ بِشُرَكَآئِهِمۡ إِن كَانُواْ صَٰدِقِينَ
data.footnotes: [1731]- i.e., those to whom they attribute divinity other than Allāh or partners from among themselves.

data.price: (42) The Day the shin will be uncovered[1732] and they are invited to prostration but they [i.e., the disbelievers] will not be able,
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ يُكۡشَفُ عَن سَاقٖ وَيُدۡعَوۡنَ إِلَى ٱلسُّجُودِ فَلَا يَسۡتَطِيعُونَ
data.footnotes: [1732]- i.e., when everyone will find before him great difficulty.  In accordance with authentic ḥadīths, "the shin" might also refer to that of Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā), before which every believer will prostrate on the Day of Judgement.  See footnote to 2:19.

data.price: (43) Their eyes humbled, humiliation will cover them. And they used to be invited to prostration while they were sound.[1733]
data.arabic: خَٰشِعَةً أَبۡصَٰرُهُمۡ تَرۡهَقُهُمۡ ذِلَّةٞۖ وَقَدۡ كَانُواْ يُدۡعَوۡنَ إِلَى ٱلسُّجُودِ وَهُمۡ سَٰلِمُونَ
data.footnotes: [1733]- During worldly life.

data.price: (44) So leave Me, [O Muḥammad], with [the matter of] whoever denies this statement [i.e., the Qur’ān]. We will progressively lead them [to punishment] from where they do not know.[1734]
data.arabic: فَذَرۡنِي وَمَن يُكَذِّبُ بِهَٰذَا ٱلۡحَدِيثِۖ سَنَسۡتَدۡرِجُهُم مِّنۡ حَيۡثُ لَا يَعۡلَمُونَ
data.footnotes: [1734]- Allāh will increase His favors to them in this world by way of trial, whereby they will sink deeper into sin and thus into destruction.

data.price: (45) And I will give them time. Indeed, My plan is firm.
(46) Or do you ask of them a payment, so they are by debt burdened down?
data.arabic: أَمۡ تَسۡـَٔلُهُمۡ أَجۡرٗا فَهُم مِّن مَّغۡرَمٖ مُّثۡقَلُونَ

data.price: (47) Or have they [knowledge of] the unseen, so they write [it] down?
(48) Then be patient for the decision of your Lord, [O Muḥammad], and be not like the companion of the fish [i.e., Jonah] when he called out while he was distressed.
data.arabic: فَٱصۡبِرۡ لِحُكۡمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تَكُن كَصَاحِبِ ٱلۡحُوتِ إِذۡ نَادَىٰ وَهُوَ مَكۡظُومٞ

data.price: (49) If not that a favor [i.e., mercy] from his Lord overtook him, he would have been thrown onto the naked shore while he was censured.[1735]
data.arabic: لَّوۡلَآ أَن تَدَٰرَكَهُۥ نِعۡمَةٞ مِّن رَّبِّهِۦ لَنُبِذَ بِٱلۡعَرَآءِ وَهُوَ مَذۡمُومٞ
data.footnotes: [1735]- But instead, Allāh accepted his repentance and provided means for his recovery.  See 37:139-148.

data.price: (50) And his Lord chose him and made him of the righteous.
(51) And indeed, those who disbelieve would almost make you slip with their eyes [i.e., looks] when they hear the message, and they say, "Indeed, he is mad."
data.arabic: وَإِن يَكَادُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ لَيُزۡلِقُونَكَ بِأَبۡصَٰرِهِمۡ لَمَّا سَمِعُواْ ٱلذِّكۡرَ وَيَقُولُونَ إِنَّهُۥ لَمَجۡنُونٞ

data.price: (52) But it is not except a reminder to the worlds.
(1) The Inevitable Reality -
(2) What is the Inevitable Reality?
(3) And what can make you know what is the Inevitable Reality?
(4) Thamūd and ʿAad denied the Striking Calamity [i.e., the Resurrection].
(5) So as for Thamūd, they were destroyed by the overpowering [blast].
(6) And as for ʿAad, they were destroyed by a screaming,[1737] violent wind
data.arabic: وَأَمَّا عَادٞ فَأُهۡلِكُواْ بِرِيحٖ صَرۡصَرٍ عَاتِيَةٖ

data.price: (7) Which He [i.e., Allāh] imposed upon them for seven nights and eight days in succession, so you would see the people therein fallen as if they were hollow trunks of palm trees.
data.arabic: سَخَّرَهَا عَلَيۡهِمۡ سَبۡعَ لَيَالٖ وَثَمَٰنِيَةَ أَيَّامٍ حُسُومٗاۖ فَتَرَى ٱلۡقَوۡمَ فِيهَا صَرۡعَىٰ كَأَنَّهُمۡ أَعۡجَازُ نَخۡلٍ خَاوِيَةٖ

data.price: (8) Then do you see of them any remains?
(9) And there came Pharaoh and those before him and the overturned cities[1738] with sin.
data.arabic: وَجَآءَ فِرۡعَوۡنُ وَمَن قَبۡلَهُۥ وَٱلۡمُؤۡتَفِكَٰتُ بِٱلۡخَاطِئَةِ
data.footnotes: [1738]- Those to which Lot was sent (see 11:82-83) or generally, all cities which were destroyed due to their denial of a messenger from Allāh.

data.price: (10) And they disobeyed the messenger of their Lord, so He seized them with a seizure exceeding [in severity].
data.arabic: فَعَصَوۡاْ رَسُولَ رَبِّهِمۡ فَأَخَذَهُمۡ أَخۡذَةٗ رَّابِيَةً

data.price: (11) Indeed, when the water overflowed, We carried you [i.e., your ancestors] in the sailing ship[1739]
data.arabic: إِنَّا لَمَّا طَغَا ٱلۡمَآءُ حَمَلۡنَٰكُمۡ فِي ٱلۡجَارِيَةِ
data.footnotes: [1739]- Which was constructed by Noah.

data.price: (12) That We might make it for you a reminder and [that] a conscious ear would be conscious of it.
data.arabic: لِنَجۡعَلَهَا لَكُمۡ تَذۡكِرَةٗ وَتَعِيَهَآ أُذُنٞ وَٰعِيَةٞ

data.price: (13) Then when the Horn is blown with one blast
data.arabic: فَإِذَا نُفِخَ فِي ٱلصُّورِ نَفۡخَةٞ وَٰحِدَةٞ

data.price: (14) And the earth and the mountains are lifted and leveled with one blow [i.e., stroke] -
data.arabic: وَحُمِلَتِ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ وَٱلۡجِبَالُ فَدُكَّتَا دَكَّةٗ وَٰحِدَةٗ

data.price: (15) Then on that Day, the Occurrence [i.e., Resurrection] will occur,
(16) And the heaven will split [open], for that Day it is infirm.[1740]
data.footnotes: [1740]- i.e., weak, enfeebled and unstable.

data.price: (17) And the angels are at its edges. And there will bear the Throne of your Lord above them, that Day, eight [of them].
data.arabic: وَٱلۡمَلَكُ عَلَىٰٓ أَرۡجَآئِهَاۚ وَيَحۡمِلُ عَرۡشَ رَبِّكَ فَوۡقَهُمۡ يَوۡمَئِذٖ ثَمَٰنِيَةٞ

data.price: (18) That Day, you will be exhibited [for judgement]; not hidden among you is anything concealed.[1741]
data.arabic: يَوۡمَئِذٖ تُعۡرَضُونَ لَا تَخۡفَىٰ مِنكُمۡ خَافِيَةٞ
data.footnotes: [1741]- i.e., any person or any secret you might attempt to conceal.

data.price: (19) So as for he who is given his record in his right hand, he will say, "Here, read my record!
data.arabic: فَأَمَّا مَنۡ أُوتِيَ كِتَٰبَهُۥ بِيَمِينِهِۦ فَيَقُولُ هَآؤُمُ ٱقۡرَءُواْ كِتَٰبِيَهۡ

data.price: (20) Indeed, I was certain that I would be meeting my account."
(21) So he will be in a pleasant life -
(22) In an elevated garden,
(23) Its [fruit] to be picked hanging near.
(24) [They will be told], "Eat and drink in satisfaction for what you put forth[1742] in the days past."
data.arabic: كُلُواْ وَٱشۡرَبُواْ هَنِيٓـَٔۢا بِمَآ أَسۡلَفۡتُمۡ فِي ٱلۡأَيَّامِ ٱلۡخَالِيَةِ
data.footnotes: [1742]- Literally, "advanced" in anticipation of reward in the Hereafter.

data.price: (25) But as for he who is given his record in his left hand, he will say, "Oh, I wish I had not been given my record
data.arabic: وَأَمَّا مَنۡ أُوتِيَ كِتَٰبَهُۥ بِشِمَالِهِۦ فَيَقُولُ يَٰلَيۡتَنِي لَمۡ أُوتَ كِتَٰبِيَهۡ

data.price: (26) And had not known what is my account.
(27) I wish it [i.e., my death] had been the decisive one.[1743]
data.footnotes: [1743]- i.e., ending life rather than being the gateway to eternal life.

data.price: (28) My wealth has not availed me.
(29) Gone from me is my authority."[1744]
data.footnotes: [1744]- i.e., I have no valid excuse to stand on.

data.price: (30) [Allāh will say], "Seize him and shackle him.
(31) Then into Hellfire drive him.
(32) Then into a chain whose length is seventy cubits insert him."
data.arabic: ثُمَّ فِي سِلۡسِلَةٖ ذَرۡعُهَا سَبۡعُونَ ذِرَاعٗا فَٱسۡلُكُوهُ

data.price: (33) Indeed, he did not used to believe in Allāh, the Most Great,
data.arabic: إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ لَا يُؤۡمِنُ بِٱللَّهِ ٱلۡعَظِيمِ

data.price: (34) Nor did he encourage the feeding of the poor.
(35) So there is not for him here this Day any devoted friend
(36) Nor any food except from the discharge of wounds;
(37) None will eat it except the sinners.
(38) So I swear by what you see
(39) And what you do not see
(40) [That] indeed, it [i.e., the Qur’ān] is the word of a noble Messenger.
(41) And it is not the word of a poet; little do you believe.
data.arabic: وَمَا هُوَ بِقَوۡلِ شَاعِرٖۚ قَلِيلٗا مَّا تُؤۡمِنُونَ

data.price: (42) Nor the word of a soothsayer; little do you remember.
data.arabic: وَلَا بِقَوۡلِ كَاهِنٖۚ قَلِيلٗا مَّا تَذَكَّرُونَ

data.price: (43) [It is] a revelation from the Lord of the worlds.
(44) And if he [i.e., Muḥammad] had made up about Us some [false] sayings,
(45) We would have seized him by the right hand;[1745]
data.footnotes: [1745]- Another interpretation is "by [Our] right hand," i.e., Allāh would have exacted revenge with might and power.

data.price: (46) Then We would have cut from him the aorta.[1746]
data.footnotes: [1746]- Causing immediate death.

data.price: (47) And there is no one of you who could prevent [Us] from him.
data.arabic: فَمَا مِنكُم مِّنۡ أَحَدٍ عَنۡهُ حَٰجِزِينَ

data.price: (48) And indeed, it [i.e., the Qur’ān] is a reminder for the righteous.
(49) And indeed, We know that among you are deniers.
(50) And indeed, it will be [a cause of] regret upon the disbelievers.
(51) And indeed, it is the truth of certainty.
(52) So exalt the name of your Lord, the Most Great.
(1) A supplicant asked for a punishment bound to happen[1748]
data.footnotes: [1748]- In the Hereafter.  Disbelievers had challenged the Prophet (ﷺ) by invoking Allāh to bring on His punishment.  See 8:32.

data.price: (2) To the disbelievers; of it there is no preventer.
(3) [It is] from Allāh, owner of the ways of ascent.
(4) The angels and the Spirit [i.e., Gabriel] will ascend to Him during a Day the extent of which is fifty thousand years.
data.arabic: تَعۡرُجُ ٱلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةُ وَٱلرُّوحُ إِلَيۡهِ فِي يَوۡمٖ كَانَ مِقۡدَارُهُۥ خَمۡسِينَ أَلۡفَ سَنَةٖ

data.price: (5) So be patient with gracious patience.
(6) Indeed, they see it [as] distant,
(7) But We see it [as] near.
(8) On the Day the sky will be like murky oil,[1749]
data.footnotes: [1749]- Or "molten metal."

data.price: (9) And the mountains will be like wool,[1750]
data.footnotes: [1750]- i.e., in the process of disintegration.

data.price: (10) And no friend will ask [anything of] a friend,
(11) They will be shown each other. The criminal will wish that he could be ransomed from the punishment of that Day by his children
data.arabic: يُبَصَّرُونَهُمۡۚ يَوَدُّ ٱلۡمُجۡرِمُ لَوۡ يَفۡتَدِي مِنۡ عَذَابِ يَوۡمِئِذِۭ بِبَنِيهِ

data.price: (12) And his wife and his brother
(13) And his nearest kindred who shelter him
(14) And whoever is on earth entirely [so] then it could save him.
data.arabic: وَمَن فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ جَمِيعٗا ثُمَّ يُنجِيهِ

data.price: (15) No![1751] Indeed, it is the Flame [of Hell],
data.footnotes: [1751]- An emphatic refusal meaning "It is not to be."

data.price: (16) A remover of exteriors.[1752]
data.footnotes: [1752]- This refers to the skin of the head or of the body or to the body extremities - which will be burned away.

data.price: (17) It invites he who turned his back [on truth] and went away [from obedience]
(18) And collected [wealth] and hoarded.
(19) Indeed, mankind was created anxious:
(20) When evil touches him, impatient,
(21) And when good touches him, withholding [of it],
(22) Except the observers of prayer -
(23) Those who are constant in their prayer
(24) And those within whose wealth is a known right[1753]
data.footnotes: [1753]- i.e., a specified share, meaning the obligatory zakāh.

data.price: (25) For the petitioner and the deprived -
(26) And those who believe in the Day of Recompense
(27) And those who are fearful of the punishment of their Lord -
data.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُم مِّنۡ عَذَابِ رَبِّهِم مُّشۡفِقُونَ

data.price: (28) Indeed, the punishment of their Lord is not that from which one is safe -
(29) And those who guard their private parts
(30) Except from their wives or those their right hands possess,[1754] for indeed, they are not to be blamed -
data.arabic: إِلَّا عَلَىٰٓ أَزۡوَٰجِهِمۡ أَوۡ مَا مَلَكَتۡ أَيۡمَٰنُهُمۡ فَإِنَّهُمۡ غَيۡرُ مَلُومِينَ
data.footnotes: [1754]- i.e., female slaves.

data.price: (31) But whoever seeks beyond that, then they are the transgressors -
data.arabic: فَمَنِ ٱبۡتَغَىٰ وَرَآءَ ذَٰلِكَ فَأُوْلَٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلۡعَادُونَ

data.price: (32) And those who are to their trusts and promises attentive
(33) And those who are in their testimonies upright
(34) And those who [carefully] maintain their prayer:
(35) They will be in gardens,[1755] honored.
data.footnotes: [1755]- In Paradise.

data.price: (36) So what is [the matter] with those who disbelieve, hastening [from] before you, [O Muḥammad],
(37) [To sit] on [your] right and [your] left in separate groups?[1756]
data.footnotes: [1756]- They sat at a distance in order to oppose and mock the Prophet (ﷺ), claiming that they would enter Paradise before the believers.

data.price: (38) Does every person among them aspire to enter a garden of pleasure?
data.arabic: أَيَطۡمَعُ كُلُّ ٱمۡرِيٕٖ مِّنۡهُمۡ أَن يُدۡخَلَ جَنَّةَ نَعِيمٖ

data.price: (39) No! Indeed, We have created them from that which they know.[1757]
data.footnotes: [1757]- i.e., a liquid disdained.  So how can they expect to enter Paradise except by the will of their Creator?

data.price: (40) So I swear by the Lord of [all] risings and settings[1758] that indeed We are able
data.arabic: فَلَآ أُقۡسِمُ بِرَبِّ ٱلۡمَشَٰرِقِ وَٱلۡمَغَٰرِبِ إِنَّا لَقَٰدِرُونَ
data.footnotes: [1758]- i.e., Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā), who determines the point at which the sun, moon and stars rise and set according to season and every position of observation.

data.price: (41) To replace them with better than them; and We are not to be outdone.
data.arabic: عَلَىٰٓ أَن نُّبَدِّلَ خَيۡرٗا مِّنۡهُمۡ وَمَا نَحۡنُ بِمَسۡبُوقِينَ

data.price: (42) So leave them to converse vainly and amuse themselves until they meet their Day which they are promised -
data.arabic: فَذَرۡهُمۡ يَخُوضُواْ وَيَلۡعَبُواْ حَتَّىٰ يُلَٰقُواْ يَوۡمَهُمُ ٱلَّذِي يُوعَدُونَ

data.price: (43) The Day they will emerge from the graves rapidly as if they were, toward an erected idol, hastening.[1759]
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ يَخۡرُجُونَ مِنَ ٱلۡأَجۡدَاثِ سِرَاعٗا كَأَنَّهُمۡ إِلَىٰ نُصُبٖ يُوفِضُونَ
data.footnotes: [1759]- i.e., just as they used to race, whenever an idol was newly appointed, to be the first of its worshippers.

data.price: (44) Their eyes humbled, humiliation will cover them. That is the Day which they had been promised.
data.arabic: خَٰشِعَةً أَبۡصَٰرُهُمۡ تَرۡهَقُهُمۡ ذِلَّةٞۚ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلۡيَوۡمُ ٱلَّذِي كَانُواْ يُوعَدُونَ

data.price: (1) Indeed, We sent Noah to his people, [saying], "Warn your people before there comes to them a painful punishment."
data.arabic: إِنَّآ أَرۡسَلۡنَا نُوحًا إِلَىٰ قَوۡمِهِۦٓ أَنۡ أَنذِرۡ قَوۡمَكَ مِن قَبۡلِ أَن يَأۡتِيَهُمۡ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٞ

data.price: (2) He said, "O my people, indeed I am to you a clear warner -
data.arabic: قَالَ يَٰقَوۡمِ إِنِّي لَكُمۡ نَذِيرٞ مُّبِينٌ

data.price: (3) To worship Allāh, fear Him and obey me.
(4) He [i.e., Allāh] will forgive you of your sins and delay you for a specified term. Indeed, the time [set by] Allāh, when it comes, will not be delayed, if you only knew."
data.arabic: يَغۡفِرۡ لَكُم مِّن ذُنُوبِكُمۡ وَيُؤَخِّرۡكُمۡ إِلَىٰٓ أَجَلٖ مُّسَمًّىۚ إِنَّ أَجَلَ ٱللَّهِ إِذَا جَآءَ لَا يُؤَخَّرُۚ لَوۡ كُنتُمۡ تَعۡلَمُونَ

data.price: (5) He said, "My Lord, indeed I invited my people [to truth] night and day.
data.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّي دَعَوۡتُ قَوۡمِي لَيۡلٗا وَنَهَارٗا

data.price: (6) But my invitation increased them not except in flight [i.e., aversion].

(7) And indeed, every time I invited them that You may forgive them, they put their fingers in their ears, covered themselves with their garments,[1761] persisted, and were arrogant with [great] arrogance.
data.arabic: وَإِنِّي كُلَّمَا دَعَوۡتُهُمۡ لِتَغۡفِرَ لَهُمۡ جَعَلُوٓاْ أَصَٰبِعَهُمۡ فِيٓ ءَاذَانِهِمۡ وَٱسۡتَغۡشَوۡاْ ثِيَابَهُمۡ وَأَصَرُّواْ وَٱسۡتَكۡبَرُواْ ٱسۡتِكۡبَارٗا
data.footnotes: [1761]- Refusing to look or listen.

data.price: (8) Then I invited them publicly.
(9) Then I announced to them and [also] confided to them secretly
data.arabic: ثُمَّ إِنِّيٓ أَعۡلَنتُ لَهُمۡ وَأَسۡرَرۡتُ لَهُمۡ إِسۡرَارٗا

data.price: (10) And said, 'Ask forgiveness of your Lord. Indeed, He is ever a Perpetual Forgiver.
data.arabic: فَقُلۡتُ ٱسۡتَغۡفِرُواْ رَبَّكُمۡ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ غَفَّارٗا

data.price: (11) He will send [rain from] the sky upon you in [continuing] showers
(12) And give you increase in wealth and children and provide for you gardens and provide for you rivers.
data.arabic: وَيُمۡدِدۡكُم بِأَمۡوَٰلٖ وَبَنِينَ وَيَجۡعَل لَّكُمۡ جَنَّٰتٖ وَيَجۡعَل لَّكُمۡ أَنۡهَٰرٗا

data.price: (13) What is [the matter] with you that you do not attribute to Allāh [due] grandeur
data.arabic: مَّا لَكُمۡ لَا تَرۡجُونَ لِلَّهِ وَقَارٗا

data.price: (14) While He has created you in stages?[1762]
data.footnotes: [1762]- i.e., in various progressive states and conditions.  See also 22:5 and 23:12-14 in reference to development of the embryo.

data.price: (15) Do you not consider how Allāh has created seven heavens in layers[1763]
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ تَرَوۡاْ كَيۡفَ خَلَقَ ٱللَّهُ سَبۡعَ سَمَٰوَٰتٖ طِبَاقٗا
data.footnotes: [1763]- See footnote to 67:3.

data.price: (16) And made the moon therein a [reflected] light and made the sun a burning lamp?
data.arabic: وَجَعَلَ ٱلۡقَمَرَ فِيهِنَّ نُورٗا وَجَعَلَ ٱلشَّمۡسَ سِرَاجٗا

data.price: (17) And Allāh has caused you to grow from the earth a [progressive] growth.
(18) Then He will return you into it and extract you [another] extraction.
(19) And Allāh has made for you the earth an expanse
(20) That you may follow therein roads of passage.'"
(21) Noah said, "My Lord, indeed they have disobeyed me and followed him whose wealth and children will not increase him except in loss.
data.arabic: قَالَ نُوحٞ رَّبِّ إِنَّهُمۡ عَصَوۡنِي وَٱتَّبَعُواْ مَن لَّمۡ يَزِدۡهُ مَالُهُۥ وَوَلَدُهُۥٓ إِلَّا خَسَارٗا

data.price: (22) And they conspired an immense conspiracy
(23) And said, 'Never leave your gods and never leave Wadd or Suwāʿ or Yaghūth and Yaʿūq and Nasr.'[1764]
data.arabic: وَقَالُواْ لَا تَذَرُنَّ ءَالِهَتَكُمۡ وَلَا تَذَرُنَّ وَدّٗا وَلَا سُوَاعٗا وَلَا يَغُوثَ وَيَعُوقَ وَنَسۡرٗا
data.footnotes: [1764]- These were the names of specific idols named after pious men of earlier generations.

data.price: (24) And already they have misled many. And, [my Lord], do not increase the wrongdoers except in error."
data.arabic: وَقَدۡ أَضَلُّواْ كَثِيرٗاۖ وَلَا تَزِدِ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ إِلَّا ضَلَٰلٗا

data.price: (25) Because of their sins they were drowned and put into the Fire, and they found not for themselves besides Allāh [any] helpers.
data.arabic: مِّمَّا خَطِيٓـَٰٔتِهِمۡ أُغۡرِقُواْ فَأُدۡخِلُواْ نَارٗا فَلَمۡ يَجِدُواْ لَهُم مِّن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ أَنصَارٗا

data.price: (26) And Noah said, "My Lord, do not leave upon the earth from among the disbelievers an inhabitant.
data.arabic: وَقَالَ نُوحٞ رَّبِّ لَا تَذَرۡ عَلَى ٱلۡأَرۡضِ مِنَ ٱلۡكَٰفِرِينَ دَيَّارًا

data.price: (27) Indeed, if You leave them, they will mislead Your servants and not beget except [every] wicked one and [confirmed] disbeliever.
data.arabic: إِنَّكَ إِن تَذَرۡهُمۡ يُضِلُّواْ عِبَادَكَ وَلَا يَلِدُوٓاْ إِلَّا فَاجِرٗا كَفَّارٗا

data.price: (28) My Lord, forgive me and my parents and whoever enters my house a believer and the believing men and believing women. And do not increase the wrongdoers except in destruction."
data.arabic: رَّبِّ ٱغۡفِرۡ لِي وَلِوَٰلِدَيَّ وَلِمَن دَخَلَ بَيۡتِيَ مُؤۡمِنٗا وَلِلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ وَٱلۡمُؤۡمِنَٰتِۖ وَلَا تَزِدِ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ إِلَّا تَبَارَۢا

data.price: (1) Say, [O Muḥammad], "It has been revealed to me that a group of the jinn listened and said, 'Indeed, we have heard an amazing Qur’ān [i.e., recitation].
data.arabic: قُلۡ أُوحِيَ إِلَيَّ أَنَّهُ ٱسۡتَمَعَ نَفَرٞ مِّنَ ٱلۡجِنِّ فَقَالُوٓاْ إِنَّا سَمِعۡنَا قُرۡءَانًا عَجَبٗا

data.price: (2) It guides to the right course, and we have believed in it. And we will never associate with our Lord anyone.
data.arabic: يَهۡدِيٓ إِلَى ٱلرُّشۡدِ فَـَٔامَنَّا بِهِۦۖ وَلَن نُّشۡرِكَ بِرَبِّنَآ أَحَدٗا

data.price: (3) And [it teaches] that exalted is the nobleness of our Lord; He has not taken a wife or a son
data.arabic: وَأَنَّهُۥ تَعَٰلَىٰ جَدُّ رَبِّنَا مَا ٱتَّخَذَ صَٰحِبَةٗ وَلَا وَلَدٗا

data.price: (4) And that our foolish one [i.e., Iblees][1766] has been saying about Allāh an excessive transgression.
data.arabic: وَأَنَّهُۥ كَانَ يَقُولُ سَفِيهُنَا عَلَى ٱللَّهِ شَطَطٗا
data.footnotes: [1766]- A plural form may also be understood, i.e., "the foolish ones among us."

data.price: (5) And we had thought that mankind and the jinn would never speak about Allāh a lie.
data.arabic: وَأَنَّا ظَنَنَّآ أَن لَّن تَقُولَ ٱلۡإِنسُ وَٱلۡجِنُّ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ كَذِبٗا

data.price: (6) And there were men from mankind who sought refuge in men from the jinn, so they [only] increased them in burden [i.e., sin].
data.arabic: وَأَنَّهُۥ كَانَ رِجَالٞ مِّنَ ٱلۡإِنسِ يَعُوذُونَ بِرِجَالٖ مِّنَ ٱلۡجِنِّ فَزَادُوهُمۡ رَهَقٗا

data.price: (7) And they had thought, as you thought, that Allāh would never send anyone [as a messenger].
data.arabic: وَأَنَّهُمۡ ظَنُّواْ كَمَا ظَنَنتُمۡ أَن لَّن يَبۡعَثَ ٱللَّهُ أَحَدٗا

data.price: (8) And we have sought [to reach] the heaven but found it filled with powerful guards and burning flames.
data.arabic: وَأَنَّا لَمَسۡنَا ٱلسَّمَآءَ فَوَجَدۡنَٰهَا مُلِئَتۡ حَرَسٗا شَدِيدٗا وَشُهُبٗا

data.price: (9) And we used to sit therein in positions for hearing,[1767] but whoever listens now will find a burning flame lying in wait for him.
data.arabic: وَأَنَّا كُنَّا نَقۡعُدُ مِنۡهَا مَقَٰعِدَ لِلسَّمۡعِۖ فَمَن يَسۡتَمِعِ ٱلۡأٓنَ يَجِدۡ لَهُۥ شِهَابٗا رَّصَدٗا
data.footnotes: [1767]- Before the prophethood of Muḥammad (ﷺ) the jinn used to collect information by eavesdropping on the angels and then pass it on to fortunetellers and soothsayers.

data.price: (10) And we do not know [therefore] whether evil is intended for those on earth or whether their Lord intends for them a right course.
data.arabic: وَأَنَّا لَا نَدۡرِيٓ أَشَرٌّ أُرِيدَ بِمَن فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ أَمۡ أَرَادَ بِهِمۡ رَبُّهُمۡ رَشَدٗا

data.price: (11) And among us are the righteous, and among us are [others] not so; we were [of] divided ways.[1768]
data.arabic: وَأَنَّا مِنَّا ٱلصَّٰلِحُونَ وَمِنَّا دُونَ ذَٰلِكَۖ كُنَّا طَرَآئِقَ قِدَدٗا
data.footnotes: [1768]- In opinion, belief and religious practice.

data.price: (12) And we have become certain that we will never cause failure to Allāh upon earth, nor can we escape Him by flight.
data.arabic: وَأَنَّا ظَنَنَّآ أَن لَّن نُّعۡجِزَ ٱللَّهَ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَلَن نُّعۡجِزَهُۥ هَرَبٗا

data.price: (13) And when we heard the guidance [i.e., the Qur’ān], we believed in it. And whoever believes in his Lord will not fear deprivation or burden.[1769]
data.arabic: وَأَنَّا لَمَّا سَمِعۡنَا ٱلۡهُدَىٰٓ ءَامَنَّا بِهِۦۖ فَمَن يُؤۡمِنۢ بِرَبِّهِۦ فَلَا يَخَافُ بَخۡسٗا وَلَا رَهَقٗا
data.footnotes: [1769]- In regard to his account in the Hereafter.  Nothing of his good will be diminished, nor will the evil of another be placed upon him.

data.price: (14) And among us are Muslims [in submission to Allāh], and among us are the unjust.[1770] And whoever has become Muslim - those have sought out the right course.
data.arabic: وَأَنَّا مِنَّا ٱلۡمُسۡلِمُونَ وَمِنَّا ٱلۡقَٰسِطُونَۖ فَمَنۡ أَسۡلَمَ فَأُوْلَٰٓئِكَ تَحَرَّوۡاْ رَشَدٗا
data.footnotes: [1770]- i.e., those who deviate from the truth and act tyrannically.

data.price: (15) But as for the unjust, they will be, for Hell, firewood.'
(16) And [Allāh revealed] that if they had remained straight on the way, We would have given them abundant rain [i.e., provision]
data.arabic: وَأَلَّوِ ٱسۡتَقَٰمُواْ عَلَى ٱلطَّرِيقَةِ لَأَسۡقَيۡنَٰهُم مَّآءً غَدَقٗا

data.price: (17) So We might test them therein. And whoever turns away from the remembrance of his Lord[1771] He will put into arduous punishment.
data.arabic: لِّنَفۡتِنَهُمۡ فِيهِۚ وَمَن يُعۡرِضۡ عَن ذِكۡرِ رَبِّهِۦ يَسۡلُكۡهُ عَذَابٗا صَعَدٗا
data.footnotes: [1771]- i.e., refuses obedience to Him.

data.price: (18) And [He revealed] that the masjids[1772] are for Allāh, so do not invoke[1773] with Allāh anyone.
data.arabic: وَأَنَّ ٱلۡمَسَٰجِدَ لِلَّهِ فَلَا تَدۡعُواْ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ أَحَدٗا
data.footnotes:
[1772]- The term "masjid" here includes every place of worship or the earth in general.
[1773]- Or "worship."

data.price: (19) And that when the Servant [i.e., Prophet] of Allāh stood up supplicating Him, they almost became about him a compacted mass."[1774]
data.arabic: وَأَنَّهُۥ لَمَّا قَامَ عَبۡدُ ٱللَّهِ يَدۡعُوهُ كَادُواْ يَكُونُونَ عَلَيۡهِ لِبَدٗا
data.footnotes: [1774]- Crowding on top of each other in the manner of locusts in order to hear him (ﷺ).  "They" may refer to the jinn or to the disbelievers among the Arabs.

data.price: (20) Say, [O Muḥammad], "I only invoke my Lord and do not associate with Him anyone."
data.arabic: قُلۡ إِنَّمَآ أَدۡعُواْ رَبِّي وَلَآ أُشۡرِكُ بِهِۦٓ أَحَدٗا

data.price: (21) Say, "Indeed, I do not possess for you [the power of] harm or right direction."
data.arabic: قُلۡ إِنِّي لَآ أَمۡلِكُ لَكُمۡ ضَرّٗا وَلَا رَشَدٗا

data.price: (22) Say, "Indeed, there will never protect me from Allāh anyone [if I should disobey], nor will I find in other than Him a refuge.
data.arabic: قُلۡ إِنِّي لَن يُجِيرَنِي مِنَ ٱللَّهِ أَحَدٞ وَلَنۡ أَجِدَ مِن دُونِهِۦ مُلۡتَحَدًا

data.price: (23) But [I have for you] only notification from Allāh, and His messages." And whoever disobeys Allāh and His Messenger - then indeed, for him is the fire of Hell; they will abide therein forever.
data.arabic: إِلَّا بَلَٰغٗا مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَرِسَٰلَٰتِهِۦۚ وَمَن يَعۡصِ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥ فَإِنَّ لَهُۥ نَارَ جَهَنَّمَ خَٰلِدِينَ فِيهَآ أَبَدًا

data.price: (24) [The disbelievers continue] until, when they see that which they are promised, then they will know who is weaker in helpers and less in number.
data.arabic: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا رَأَوۡاْ مَا يُوعَدُونَ فَسَيَعۡلَمُونَ مَنۡ أَضۡعَفُ نَاصِرٗا وَأَقَلُّ عَدَدٗا

data.price: (25) Say, "I do not know if what you are promised is near or if my Lord will grant for it a [long] period."
data.arabic: قُلۡ إِنۡ أَدۡرِيٓ أَقَرِيبٞ مَّا تُوعَدُونَ أَمۡ يَجۡعَلُ لَهُۥ رَبِّيٓ أَمَدًا

data.price: (26) [He is] Knower of the unseen, and He does not disclose His [knowledge of the] unseen to anyone
data.arabic: عَٰلِمُ ٱلۡغَيۡبِ فَلَا يُظۡهِرُ عَلَىٰ غَيۡبِهِۦٓ أَحَدًا

data.price: (27) Except whom He has approved of messengers, and indeed, He sends before him [i.e., each messenger] and behind him observers[1775]
data.arabic: إِلَّا مَنِ ٱرۡتَضَىٰ مِن رَّسُولٖ فَإِنَّهُۥ يَسۡلُكُ مِنۢ بَيۡنِ يَدَيۡهِ وَمِنۡ خَلۡفِهِۦ رَصَدٗا
data.footnotes: [1775]- Guardian angels to protect the messenger and the message.

data.price: (28) That he [i.e., Muḥammad (ﷺ)] may know[1776] that they have conveyed the messages of their Lord; and He has encompassed whatever is with them and has enumerated all things in number.
data.arabic: لِّيَعۡلَمَ أَن قَدۡ أَبۡلَغُواْ رِسَٰلَٰتِ رَبِّهِمۡ وَأَحَاطَ بِمَا لَدَيۡهِمۡ وَأَحۡصَىٰ كُلَّ شَيۡءٍ عَدَدَۢا
data.footnotes: [1776]- This phrase may also be read:  "So He [i.e., Allāh] may make evident."

data.price: (1) O you who wraps himself [in clothing],[1778]
data.footnotes: [1778]- Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) addresses the Prophet (ﷺ), who was asleep, wrapped in his garments.

data.price: (2) Arise [to pray] the night, except for a little -
(3) Half of it - or subtract from it a little
(4) Or add to it, and recite the Qur’ān with measured recitation.
data.arabic: أَوۡ زِدۡ عَلَيۡهِ وَرَتِّلِ ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ تَرۡتِيلًا

data.price: (5) Indeed, We will cast upon you a heavy word.[1779]
data.footnotes: [1779]- i.e., the revelation, which when descending on the Prophet (ﷺ) bore down upon him with a great weight.  Another meaning is "important ordinances."

data.price: (6) Indeed, the hours of the night are more effective for concurrence [of heart and tongue][1780] and more suitable for words.[1781]
data.arabic: إِنَّ نَاشِئَةَ ٱلَّيۡلِ هِيَ أَشَدُّ وَطۡـٔٗا وَأَقۡوَمُ قِيلًا
data.footnotes:
[1780]- Another accepted interpretation of the same words is "Indeed, arising at night is more difficult...," meaning that it will only be done by sincere believers and not others.
[1781]- i.e., for recitation of the Qur’ān and for hearing and understanding it.

data.price: (7) Indeed, for you by day is prolonged occupation.
data.arabic: إِنَّ لَكَ فِي ٱلنَّهَارِ سَبۡحٗا طَوِيلٗا

data.price: (8) And remember the name of your Lord and devote yourself to Him with [complete] devotion.
data.arabic: وَٱذۡكُرِ ٱسۡمَ رَبِّكَ وَتَبَتَّلۡ إِلَيۡهِ تَبۡتِيلٗا

data.price: (9) [He is] the Lord of the East and the West; there is no deity except Him, so take Him as Disposer of [your] affairs.[1782]
data.arabic: رَّبُّ ٱلۡمَشۡرِقِ وَٱلۡمَغۡرِبِ لَآ إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ فَٱتَّخِذۡهُ وَكِيلٗا
data.footnotes: [1782]- i.e., trust in Allāh and rely upon Him.

data.price: (10) And be patient over what they say and avoid them with gracious avoidance.
data.arabic: وَٱصۡبِرۡ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَٱهۡجُرۡهُمۡ هَجۡرٗا جَمِيلٗا

data.price: (11) And leave Me with [the matter of] the deniers, those of ease [in life], and allow them respite a little.
data.arabic: وَذَرۡنِي وَٱلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ أُوْلِي ٱلنَّعۡمَةِ وَمَهِّلۡهُمۡ قَلِيلًا

data.price: (12) Indeed, with Us [for them] are shackles and burning fire
(13) And food that chokes and a painful punishment -
(14) On the Day the earth and the mountains will convulse and the mountains will become a heap of sand pouring down.
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ تَرۡجُفُ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ وَٱلۡجِبَالُ وَكَانَتِ ٱلۡجِبَالُ كَثِيبٗا مَّهِيلًا

data.price: (15) Indeed, We have sent to you a Messenger as a witness upon you just as We sent to Pharaoh a messenger.
data.arabic: إِنَّآ أَرۡسَلۡنَآ إِلَيۡكُمۡ رَسُولٗا شَٰهِدًا عَلَيۡكُمۡ كَمَآ أَرۡسَلۡنَآ إِلَىٰ فِرۡعَوۡنَ رَسُولٗا

data.price: (16) But Pharaoh disobeyed the messenger, so We seized him with a ruinous seizure.
data.arabic: فَعَصَىٰ فِرۡعَوۡنُ ٱلرَّسُولَ فَأَخَذۡنَٰهُ أَخۡذٗا وَبِيلٗا

data.price: (17) Then how can you fear, if you disbelieve, a Day that will make the children white-haired?[1783]
data.arabic: فَكَيۡفَ تَتَّقُونَ إِن كَفَرۡتُمۡ يَوۡمٗا يَجۡعَلُ ٱلۡوِلۡدَٰنَ شِيبًا
data.footnotes: [1783]- Another meaning is "How can you avoid [punishment]" on such a Day?

data.price: (18) The heaven will break apart therefrom;[1784] ever is His promise fulfilled.
data.arabic: ٱلسَّمَآءُ مُنفَطِرُۢ بِهِۦۚ كَانَ وَعۡدُهُۥ مَفۡعُولًا
data.footnotes: [1784]- From the terror of that Day.

data.price: (19) Indeed, this is a reminder, so whoever wills may take to his Lord a way.
data.arabic: إِنَّ هَٰذِهِۦ تَذۡكِرَةٞۖ فَمَن شَآءَ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ سَبِيلًا

data.price: (20) Indeed, your Lord knows, [O Muḥammad], that you stand [in prayer] almost two thirds of the night or half of it or a third of it, and [so do] a group of those with you. And Allāh determines [the extent of] the night and the day. He has known that you [Muslims] will not be able to do it[1785] and has turned to you in forgiveness, so recite what is easy [for you] of the Qur’ān. He has known that there will be among you those who are ill and others traveling throughout the land seeking [something] of the bounty of Allāh and others fighting for the cause of Allāh. So recite what is easy from it and establish prayer and give zakāh and loan Allāh a goodly loan.[1786] And whatever good you put forward for yourselves - you will find it with Allāh. It is better and greater in reward. And seek forgiveness of Allāh. Indeed, Allāh is Forgiving and Merciful.
data.arabic: ۞ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ يَعۡلَمُ أَنَّكَ تَقُومُ أَدۡنَىٰ مِن ثُلُثَيِ ٱلَّيۡلِ وَنِصۡفَهُۥ وَثُلُثَهُۥ وَطَآئِفَةٞ مِّنَ ٱلَّذِينَ مَعَكَۚ وَٱللَّهُ يُقَدِّرُ ٱلَّيۡلَ وَٱلنَّهَارَۚ عَلِمَ أَن لَّن تُحۡصُوهُ فَتَابَ عَلَيۡكُمۡۖ فَٱقۡرَءُواْ مَا تَيَسَّرَ مِنَ ٱلۡقُرۡءَانِۚ عَلِمَ أَن سَيَكُونُ مِنكُم مَّرۡضَىٰ وَءَاخَرُونَ يَضۡرِبُونَ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ يَبۡتَغُونَ مِن فَضۡلِ ٱللَّهِ وَءَاخَرُونَ يُقَٰتِلُونَ فِي سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِۖ فَٱقۡرَءُواْ مَا تَيَسَّرَ مِنۡهُۚ وَأَقِيمُواْ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَءَاتُواْ ٱلزَّكَوٰةَ وَأَقۡرِضُواْ ٱللَّهَ قَرۡضًا حَسَنٗاۚ وَمَا تُقَدِّمُواْ لِأَنفُسِكُم مِّنۡ خَيۡرٖ تَجِدُوهُ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ هُوَ خَيۡرٗا وَأَعۡظَمَ أَجۡرٗاۚ وَٱسۡتَغۡفِرُواْ ٱللَّهَۖ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ غَفُورٞ رَّحِيمُۢ
data.footnotes:
[1785]- Allāh has known that if they were to continue in such long periods of worship each night, the people would be caused much hardship.
[1786]- In the form of charities and contributions to His cause.

data.price: (1) O you who covers himself [with a garment],[1788]
data.footnotes: [1788]- Referring to the Prophet (ﷺ).

data.price: (2) Arise and warn
(3) And your Lord glorify
(4) And your clothing purify
(5) And uncleanliness[1789] avoid
data.footnotes: [1789]- Specifically, idols or generally, bad conduct and morals.

data.price: (6) And do not confer favor to acquire more[1790]
data.footnotes: [1790]- An alternative meaning is "Do not consider any favor you have conferred to be great."

data.price: (7) But for your Lord be patient.
(8) And when the trumpet is blown,
(9) That Day will be a difficult day
(10) For the disbelievers - not easy.
(11) Leave Me with the one I created alone[1791]
data.footnotes: [1791]- i.e., without wealth or children.  The reference is to al-Waleed bin al-Mugheerah, who after inclining toward the Qur’ān, denied it publicly in order to win the approval of the Quraysh.

data.price: (12) And to whom I granted extensive wealth
(13) And children present [with him]
(14) And spread [everything] before him, easing [his life].
(15) Then he desires that I should add more.
(16) No! Indeed, he has been toward Our verses obstinate.
(17) I will cover him with arduous torment.
(18) Indeed, he thought and deliberated.[1792]
data.footnotes: [1792]- About what he would say concerning the Qur’ān and how he might discredit the Prophet (ﷺ).

data.price: (19) So may he be destroyed [for] how he deliberated.
(20) Then may he be destroyed [for] how he deliberated.
(21) Then he considered [again];
(22) Then he frowned and scowled;
(23) Then he turned back and was arrogant
(24) And said, "This is not but magic imitated [from others].
data.arabic: فَقَالَ إِنۡ هَٰذَآ إِلَّا سِحۡرٞ يُؤۡثَرُ

data.price: (25) This is not but the word of a human being."
(26) I will drive him into Saqar.[1793]
data.footnotes: [1793]- One of the proper names of Hell.

data.price: (27) And what can make you know what is Saqar?
(28) It lets nothing remain and leaves nothing [unburned],
(29) Altering [i.e., blackening] the skins.
(30) Over it are nineteen [angels].

(31) And We have not made the keepers of the Fire except angels. And We have not made their number except as a trial for those who disbelieve - that those who were given the Scripture will be convinced and those who have believed will increase in faith and those who were given the Scripture and the believers will not doubt and that those in whose hearts is disease [i.e., hypocrisy] and the disbelievers will say, "What does Allāh intend by this as an example?" Thus does Allāh send astray whom He wills and guide whom He wills. And none knows the soldiers of your Lord except Him. And it [i.e., mention of the Fire] is not but a reminder to humanity.
data.arabic: وَمَا جَعَلۡنَآ أَصۡحَٰبَ ٱلنَّارِ إِلَّا مَلَٰٓئِكَةٗۖ وَمَا جَعَلۡنَا عِدَّتَهُمۡ إِلَّا فِتۡنَةٗ لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ لِيَسۡتَيۡقِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُواْ ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ وَيَزۡدَادَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓاْ إِيمَٰنٗا وَلَا يَرۡتَابَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُواْ ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ وَٱلۡمُؤۡمِنُونَ وَلِيَقُولَ ٱلَّذِينَ فِي قُلُوبِهِم مَّرَضٞ وَٱلۡكَٰفِرُونَ مَاذَآ أَرَادَ ٱللَّهُ بِهَٰذَا مَثَلٗاۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يُضِلُّ ٱللَّهُ مَن يَشَآءُ وَيَهۡدِي مَن يَشَآءُۚ وَمَا يَعۡلَمُ جُنُودَ رَبِّكَ إِلَّا هُوَۚ وَمَا هِيَ إِلَّا ذِكۡرَىٰ لِلۡبَشَرِ

data.price: (32) No! By the moon
(33) And [by] the night when it departs
(34) And [by] the morning when it brightens,
(35) Indeed, it [i.e., the Fire] is of the greatest [afflictions]
(36) As a warning to humanity -
(37) To whoever wills among you to proceed[1794] or stay behind.
data.arabic: لِمَن شَآءَ مِنكُمۡ أَن يَتَقَدَّمَ أَوۡ يَتَأَخَّرَ
data.footnotes: [1794]- To righteousness by acceptance of the warning.

data.price: (38) Every soul, for what it has earned, will be retained[1795]
data.footnotes: [1795]- i.e., subject or held responsible.

data.price: (39) Except the companions of the right,[1796].
data.footnotes: [1796]- i.e., the righteous who receive their records in their right hands.

data.price: (40) [Who will be] in gardens, questioning each other
(41) About the criminals,
(42) [And asking them], "What put you into Saqar?"
(43) They will say, "We were not of those who prayed,
(44) Nor did we used to feed the poor.
(45) And we used to enter into vain discourse with those who engaged [in it],
(46) And we used to deny the Day of Recompense
(47) Until there came to us the certainty [i.e., death]."
(48) So there will not benefit them the intercession of [any] intercessors.
(49) Then what is [the matter] with them that they are, from the reminder, turning away
(50) As if they were alarmed donkeys
(51) Fleeing from a lion?
(52) Rather, every person among them desires that he[1797] would be given scriptures spread about.[1798]
data.arabic: بَلۡ يُرِيدُ كُلُّ ٱمۡرِيٕٖ مِّنۡهُمۡ أَن يُؤۡتَىٰ صُحُفٗا مُّنَشَّرَةٗ
data.footnotes:
[1797]- Instead of Muḥammad (ﷺ).
[1798]- i.e., made public.  Much of their refusal of his message was due to envy and jealousy of the Prophet (ﷺ).

data.price: (53) No! But they do not fear the Hereafter.
(54) No! Indeed, it [i.e., the Qur’ān] is a reminder
(55) Then whoever wills will remember it.
(56) And they will not remember except that Allāh wills. He is worthy of fear and adequate for [granting] forgiveness.
data.arabic: وَمَا يَذۡكُرُونَ إِلَّآ أَن يَشَآءَ ٱللَّهُۚ هُوَ أَهۡلُ ٱلتَّقۡوَىٰ وَأَهۡلُ ٱلۡمَغۡفِرَةِ

data.price: (1) I swear by the Day of Resurrection
(2) And I swear by the reproaching soul[1800] [to the certainty of resurrection].
data.footnotes: [1800]- i.e., that of the believer, which blames him when he falls into sin or error.

data.price: (3) Does man think that We will not assemble his bones?
(4) Yes. [We are] Able [even] to proportion his fingertips.
data.arabic: بَلَىٰ قَٰدِرِينَ عَلَىٰٓ أَن نُّسَوِّيَ بَنَانَهُۥ

data.price: (5) But man desires to continue in sin.[1801]
data.footnotes: [1801]- Literally, "to sin ahead of him."  This refers to the disbeliever, who denies the Day of Account.

data.price: (6) He asks, "When is the Day of Resurrection?"
(7) So when vision is dazzled
(8) And the moon darkens
(9) And the sun and the moon are joined,
(10) Man will say on that Day, "Where is the [place of] escape?"
(11) No! There is no refuge.
(12) To your Lord, that Day, is the [place of] permanence.
(13) Man will be informed that Day of what he sent ahead[1802] and kept back.[1803]
data.arabic: يُنَبَّؤُاْ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ يَوۡمَئِذِۭ بِمَا قَدَّمَ وَأَخَّرَ
data.footnotes:
[1802]- i.e., his deeds, which await him in the Hereafter.
[1803]- i.e., that which he did not do or which he delayed.

data.price: (14) Rather, man, against himself, will be a witness,[1804]
data.footnotes: [1804]- As described in 36:65 and 41:20-23.

data.price: (15) Even if he presents his excuses.
(16) Move not your tongue with it, [O Muḥammad], to hasten with it [i.e., recitation of the Qur’ān].
data.arabic: لَا تُحَرِّكۡ بِهِۦ لِسَانَكَ لِتَعۡجَلَ بِهِۦٓ

data.price: (17) Indeed, upon Us is its collection [in your heart] and [to make possible] its recitation.
(18) So when We have recited it [through Gabriel], then follow its recitation.
(19) Then upon Us is its clarification [to you].
(20) No! But you [i.e., mankind] love the immediate
(21) And leave [i.e., neglect] the Hereafter.
(22) [Some] faces, that Day, will be radiant,
(23) Looking at their Lord.[1805]
data.footnotes: [1805]- The people of Paradise will actually see their Creator in the Hereafter.

data.price: (24) And [some] faces, that Day, will be contorted,
(25) Expecting that there will be done to them [something] backbreaking.
(26) No! When it [i.e., the soul] has reached the collar bones[1806]
data.footnotes: [1806]- At the time it is about to leave the body when one is on the verge of death.

data.price: (27) And it is said, "Who will cure [him]?"
(28) And he [i.e., the dying one] is certain that it is the [time of] separation
(29) And the leg is wound about the leg,[1807]
data.footnotes: [1807]- From the difficulties the person faces at death or his sudden awareness of the realities of both this world and the Hereafter.  It may also refer to his shrouding after death.

data.price: (30) To your Lord, that Day, will be the procession.[1808]
data.footnotes: [1808]- Literally, "driving" or "herding" or "the place to which one is driven."

data.price: (31) And he [i.e., the disbeliever] had not believed, nor had he prayed.
(32) But [instead], he denied and turned away.
(33) And then he went to his people, swaggering [in pride].
(34) Woe to you, and woe!
(35) Then woe to you, and woe!
(36) Does man think that he will be left neglected?[1809]
data.footnotes: [1809]- i.e., to no end, without responsibility, or without being returned to the Creator for judgement.

data.price: (37) Had he not been a sperm from semen emitted?
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ يَكُ نُطۡفَةٗ مِّن مَّنِيّٖ يُمۡنَىٰ

data.price: (38) Then he was a clinging clot, and [Allāh] created [his form] and proportioned [him]
(39) And made of him two mates, the male and the female.
(40) Is not that [Creator] Able to give life to the dead?
data.arabic: أَلَيۡسَ ذَٰلِكَ بِقَٰدِرٍ عَلَىٰٓ أَن يُحۡـِۧيَ ٱلۡمَوۡتَىٰ

data.price: (1) Has there [not] come upon man a period of time when he was not a thing [even] mentioned?
data.arabic: هَلۡ أَتَىٰ عَلَى ٱلۡإِنسَٰنِ حِينٞ مِّنَ ٱلدَّهۡرِ لَمۡ يَكُن شَيۡـٔٗا مَّذۡكُورًا

data.price: (2) Indeed, We created man from a sperm-drop mixture[1811] that We may try him; and We made him hearing and seeing.
data.arabic: إِنَّا خَلَقۡنَا ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ مِن نُّطۡفَةٍ أَمۡشَاجٖ نَّبۡتَلِيهِ فَجَعَلۡنَٰهُ سَمِيعَۢا بَصِيرًا
data.footnotes: [1811]- i.e., a combination of the male and female substance, within the womb.

data.price: (3) Indeed, We guided him to the way, be he grateful or be he ungrateful.
data.arabic: إِنَّا هَدَيۡنَٰهُ ٱلسَّبِيلَ إِمَّا شَاكِرٗا وَإِمَّا كَفُورًا

data.price: (4) Indeed, We have prepared for the disbelievers chains and shackles and a blaze.
data.arabic: إِنَّآ أَعۡتَدۡنَا لِلۡكَٰفِرِينَ سَلَٰسِلَاْ وَأَغۡلَٰلٗا وَسَعِيرًا

data.price: (5) Indeed, the righteous will drink from a cup [of wine] whose mixture is of Kāfūr,[1812]
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلۡأَبۡرَارَ يَشۡرَبُونَ مِن كَأۡسٖ كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا كَافُورًا
data.footnotes: [1812]- A sweet-smelling spring in Paradise.

data.price: (6) A spring of which the [righteous] servants of Allāh will drink; they will make it gush forth in force [and abundance].
data.arabic: عَيۡنٗا يَشۡرَبُ بِهَا عِبَادُ ٱللَّهِ يُفَجِّرُونَهَا تَفۡجِيرٗا

data.price: (7) They [are those who] fulfill [their] vows and fear a Day whose evil will be widespread.
data.arabic: يُوفُونَ بِٱلنَّذۡرِ وَيَخَافُونَ يَوۡمٗا كَانَ شَرُّهُۥ مُسۡتَطِيرٗا

data.price: (8) And they give food in spite of love for it[1813] to the needy, the orphan, and the captive,
data.arabic: وَيُطۡعِمُونَ ٱلطَّعَامَ عَلَىٰ حُبِّهِۦ مِسۡكِينٗا وَيَتِيمٗا وَأَسِيرًا
data.footnotes: [1813]- The meaning here may also be "out of love for Him," i.e., Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā).

data.price: (9) [Saying], "We feed you only for the face [i.e., approval] of Allāh. We wish not from you reward or gratitude.
data.arabic: إِنَّمَا نُطۡعِمُكُمۡ لِوَجۡهِ ٱللَّهِ لَا نُرِيدُ مِنكُمۡ جَزَآءٗ وَلَا شُكُورًا

data.price: (10) Indeed, We fear from our Lord a Day austere and distressful."
data.arabic: إِنَّا نَخَافُ مِن رَّبِّنَا يَوۡمًا عَبُوسٗا قَمۡطَرِيرٗا

data.price: (11) So Allāh will protect them from the evil of that Day and give them radiance and happiness
data.arabic: فَوَقَىٰهُمُ ٱللَّهُ شَرَّ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلۡيَوۡمِ وَلَقَّىٰهُمۡ نَضۡرَةٗ وَسُرُورٗا

data.price: (12) And will reward them for what they patiently endured [with] a garden [in Paradise] and silk [garments].
(13) [They will be] reclining therein on adorned couches. They will not see therein any [burning] sun or [freezing] cold.
data.arabic: مُّتَّكِـِٔينَ فِيهَا عَلَى ٱلۡأَرَآئِكِۖ لَا يَرَوۡنَ فِيهَا شَمۡسٗا وَلَا زَمۡهَرِيرٗا

data.price: (14) And near above them are its shades, and its [fruit] to be picked will be lowered in compliance.
data.arabic: وَدَانِيَةً عَلَيۡهِمۡ ظِلَٰلُهَا وَذُلِّلَتۡ قُطُوفُهَا تَذۡلِيلٗا

data.price: (15) And there will be circulated among them vessels of silver and cups having been [created] clear [as glass],
data.arabic: وَيُطَافُ عَلَيۡهِم بِـَٔانِيَةٖ مِّن فِضَّةٖ وَأَكۡوَابٖ كَانَتۡ قَوَارِيرَا۠

data.price: (16) Clear glasses [made] from silver of which they have determined the measure.
(17) And they will be given to drink a cup [of wine] whose mixture is of ginger
data.arabic: وَيُسۡقَوۡنَ فِيهَا كَأۡسٗا كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا زَنجَبِيلًا

data.price: (18) [From] a fountain within it [i.e., Paradise] named Salsabeel.
(19) There will circulate among them young boys made eternal. When you see them, you would think them [as beautiful as] scattered pearls.
data.arabic: ۞ وَيَطُوفُ عَلَيۡهِمۡ وِلۡدَٰنٞ مُّخَلَّدُونَ إِذَا رَأَيۡتَهُمۡ حَسِبۡتَهُمۡ لُؤۡلُؤٗا مَّنثُورٗا

data.price: (20) And when you look there [in Paradise], you will see pleasure and great dominion.
data.arabic: وَإِذَا رَأَيۡتَ ثَمَّ رَأَيۡتَ نَعِيمٗا وَمُلۡكٗا كَبِيرًا

data.price: (21) Upon them [i.e., the inhabitants] will be green garments of fine silk and brocade. And they will be adorned with bracelets of silver, and their Lord will give them a purifying drink.
data.arabic: عَٰلِيَهُمۡ ثِيَابُ سُندُسٍ خُضۡرٞ وَإِسۡتَبۡرَقٞۖ وَحُلُّوٓاْ أَسَاوِرَ مِن فِضَّةٖ وَسَقَىٰهُمۡ رَبُّهُمۡ شَرَابٗا طَهُورًا

data.price: (22) [And it will be said], "Indeed, this is for you a reward, and your effort has been appreciated."
data.arabic: إِنَّ هَٰذَا كَانَ لَكُمۡ جَزَآءٗ وَكَانَ سَعۡيُكُم مَّشۡكُورًا

data.price: (23) Indeed, it is We who have sent down to you, [O Muḥammad], the Qur’ān progressively.
data.arabic: إِنَّا نَحۡنُ نَزَّلۡنَا عَلَيۡكَ ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ تَنزِيلٗا

data.price: (24) So be patient for the decision of your Lord and do not obey from among them a sinner or ungrateful [disbeliever].
data.arabic: فَٱصۡبِرۡ لِحُكۡمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تُطِعۡ مِنۡهُمۡ ءَاثِمًا أَوۡ كَفُورٗا

data.price: (25) And mention the name of your Lord [in prayer] morning and evening
(26) And during the night prostrate to Him and exalt [i.e., praise] Him a long [part of the] night.
data.arabic: وَمِنَ ٱلَّيۡلِ فَٱسۡجُدۡ لَهُۥ وَسَبِّحۡهُ لَيۡلٗا طَوِيلًا

data.price: (27) Indeed, these [disbelievers] love the immediate and leave behind them[1814] a grave Day.
data.arabic: إِنَّ هَٰٓؤُلَآءِ يُحِبُّونَ ٱلۡعَاجِلَةَ وَيَذَرُونَ وَرَآءَهُمۡ يَوۡمٗا ثَقِيلٗا
data.footnotes: [1814]- i.e., neglect.  The meaning may also be "leave ahead of them."

data.price: (28) We have created them and strengthened their forms, and when We will, We can change their likenesses with [complete] alteration.
data.arabic: نَّحۡنُ خَلَقۡنَٰهُمۡ وَشَدَدۡنَآ أَسۡرَهُمۡۖ وَإِذَا شِئۡنَا بَدَّلۡنَآ أَمۡثَٰلَهُمۡ تَبۡدِيلًا

data.price: (29) Indeed, this is a reminder, so he who wills may take to his Lord a way.
data.arabic: إِنَّ هَٰذِهِۦ تَذۡكِرَةٞۖ فَمَن شَآءَ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ سَبِيلٗا

data.price: (30) And you do not will except that Allāh wills. Indeed, Allāh is ever Knowing and Wise.
data.arabic: وَمَا تَشَآءُونَ إِلَّآ أَن يَشَآءَ ٱللَّهُۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ كَانَ عَلِيمًا حَكِيمٗا

data.price: (31) He admits whom He wills into His mercy; but the wrongdoers - He has prepared for them a painful punishment.
data.arabic: يُدۡخِلُ مَن يَشَآءُ فِي رَحۡمَتِهِۦۚ وَٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ أَعَدَّ لَهُمۡ عَذَابًا أَلِيمَۢا

data.price: (1) By those [winds] sent forth in gusts
(2) And the winds that blow violently
(3) And [by] the winds that spread [clouds]
(4) And those [angels] who bring criterion[1816]
data.footnotes: [1816]- To Allāh's human messengers.

data.price: (5) And those [angels] who deliver a message
(6) As justification or warning,
(7) Indeed, what you are promised is to occur.
(8) So when the stars are obliterated
(9) And when the heaven is opened
(10) And when the mountains are blown away
(11) And when the messengers' time has come...[1817]
data.footnotes: [1817]- i.e., when they are gathered to witness concerning their nations.  The sentence's conclusion is understood to be "...the promised judgement will then take place."

data.price: (12) For what Day was it postponed?[1818]
data.footnotes: [1818]- "It" may refer to either the aforementioned occurrences collectively or to the testimony of the messengers.

data.price: (13) For the Day of Judgement.
(14) And what can make you know what is the Day of Judgement?
(15) Woe,[1819] that Day, to the deniers.
data.footnotes: [1819]- i.e., death and destruction.

data.price: (16) Did We not destroy the former peoples?
(17) Then We will follow them with the later ones.
(18) Thus do We deal with the criminals.
(19) Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
(20) Did We not create you from a liquid disdained?
(21) And We placed it in a firm lodging [i.e., the womb]
(22) For a known extent.
(23) And We determined [it], and excellent [are We] to determine.
(24) Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
(25) Have We not made the earth a container
(26) Of the living and the dead?
(27) And We placed therein lofty, firmly set mountains and have given you to drink sweet water.
data.arabic: وَجَعَلۡنَا فِيهَا رَوَٰسِيَ شَٰمِخَٰتٖ وَأَسۡقَيۡنَٰكُم مَّآءٗ فُرَاتٗا

data.price: (28) Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
(29) [They will be told], "Proceed to that which you used to deny.
data.arabic: ٱنطَلِقُوٓاْ إِلَىٰ مَا كُنتُم بِهِۦ تُكَذِّبُونَ

data.price: (30) Proceed to a shadow [of smoke] having three columns
data.arabic: ٱنطَلِقُوٓاْ إِلَىٰ ظِلّٖ ذِي ثَلَٰثِ شُعَبٖ

data.price: (31) [But having] no cool shade and availing not against the flame."
data.arabic: لَّا ظَلِيلٖ وَلَا يُغۡنِي مِنَ ٱللَّهَبِ

data.price: (32) Indeed, it throws sparks [as huge] as a fortress,
(33) As if they were yellowish [black] camels.
(34) Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
(35) This is a Day they will not speak,
(36) Nor will it be permitted for them to make an excuse.
(37) Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
(38) This is the Day of Judgement; We will have assembled you and the former peoples.
(39) So if you have a plan, then plan against Me.
(40) Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
(41) Indeed, the righteous will be among shades and springs
(42) And fruits from whatever they desire,
(43) [Being told], "Eat and drink in satisfaction for what you used to do."
data.arabic: كُلُواْ وَٱشۡرَبُواْ هَنِيٓـَٔۢا بِمَا كُنتُمۡ تَعۡمَلُونَ

data.price: (44) Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.
(45) Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
(46) [O disbelievers], eat and enjoy yourselves a little; indeed, you are criminals.
(47) Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
(48) And when it is said to them, "Bow [in prayer]," they do not bow.
data.arabic: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمُ ٱرۡكَعُواْ لَا يَرۡكَعُونَ

data.price: (49) Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
(50) Then in what statement after it [i.e., the Qur’ān] will they believe?
